required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Recombinant Anti-HER2 Humanized Monoclonal Antibody (GB221) for Injection
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Multi-center Phase Ⅲ Clinical Study to Evaluate the Recombinant Anti-HER2 Humanized Monoclonal Antibody or Placebo in Combination With Capecitabine for the Treatment of HER-2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this trial is to compare the progression-free survival (PFS) in two groups of combined therapy of GB221/ capecitabine tablets versus combined therapy of placebo/capecitabine tablets; the secondary objective is to evaluate the objective response rate (ORR),time to progression (TTP) from treatment period to week 12; overall survival (OS), safety, immunogenicity (anti-drug antibody), PFS of subjects during continued treatment period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of GB221 as defined by progression-free survival in patients with breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of GB221 as defined by overall response rate, in patients with breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the duration from the first administration to death because of any reason in patients with breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: PFS in the extended treatment phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: PFS in the extended treatment phase

intervention.description: GB221:Lyophilized powder for injection; strength 110mg/bottle; the first administration of 8 mg/kg, intravenous drip for over 90 minutes; subsequently, the administration shall be given once every 3 weeks (one cycle), the dose is 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip for 30~90 minutes; The administration shall be continued until disease progression or presence of intolerable toxic reactions or subject's active withdrawal from clinical study. Capecitabine:Tablets; 500mg/tablet, 12 tablets/box; Total daily dose 2000 mg/m2, orally twice daily, one dose each in the morning and evening, administration for 2 weeks followed by a 1-week rest period, as a 3-week cycle. The administration shall be continued until disease progression or presence of intolerable toxic reactions or subject's active withdrawal from clinical study.

Placebo control:Lyophilized powder for injection; strength 110mg/bottle; the first administration of 8 mg/kg, intravenous drip for over 90 minutes; subsequently, the administration shall be given once every 3 weeks (one cycle), the dose is 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip for 30~90 minutes; The administration shall be continued until disease progression or presence of intolerable toxic reactions or subject's active withdrawal from clinical study. Capecitabine:Tablets; 500mg/tablet, 12 tablets/box; Total daily dose 2000 mg/m2, orally twice daily, one dose each in the morning and evening, administration for 2 weeks followed by a 1-week rest period, as a 3-week cycle. The administration shall be continued until disease progression or presence of intolerable toxic reactions or subject's active withdrawal from clinical study.

facility.name: People's Liberation Army General Hospital The Fifth Medical Center
